Articles.Content:
**How to code in C#**

Hello Everyone after 6 hours of uploading here it is. ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

This is a C# tutorial split up into 10 days with 2-3 hours of Video instruction each day. There are also bonuses included in the file to with other languages to learn there are E-Books.

But I will suggest learning C# first then the others.

Learning C# will enable you to make mods for KSP and is just helpful over all to know.

Requirements: 

\/ Visual C# 2010 Express \/ You will need a Microsoft account .

[http://go.microsoft.com/?linkid=9709939&clcid=0x409&wt.mc_id=o~msft~vscom~download-body~dn469506&campaign=o~msft~vscom~download-body~dn469506](https://go.microsoft.com/?linkid=9709939&clcid=0x409&wt.mc_id=o~msft~vscom~download-body~dn469506&campaign=o~msft~vscom~download-body~dn469506)

Want for more than 90 day trial?

Go on a Legal site and search for this Visual C# 2010 Express 

\/ Download Link \/ You also need 7-zip to extract the file

[https://mega.co.nz/#!DcQmhD5R!XoO_t16w2uca4T6OTS7aDyqm9SqKJzvzpunJNaFw8v4](https://mega.co.nz/#!DcQmhD5R!XoO_t16w2uca4T6OTS7aDyqm9SqKJzvzpunJNaFw8v4)

I expect this will be useful for a lot of people North, thanks, also there's the free Monodevelop for other OS's, though it may be tricky to follow your tutorial with different tools ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

Thanks sal\_vager , i will tried to limit it. But you need all tools for it to function correctly and it only works with Visual C# 2010 Express

**Edited <time datetime="2015-03-10T23:30:49Z" title="03/10/2015 11:30  PM" data-short="9 yr">March 10, 2015</time> by North**

Do you need to have an account with Mega to download this file quicker? I'm getting a mere 14 kb/sec or it just errors out completely.

Thanks.

North, that Mega link is to an 8.3 gig file, what is it? derp, it's the tutorial.

North, can you do several smaller downloads instead please, and put any videos on youtube instead of in the archive, thank you.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-03-11T00:48:55Z" title="03/11/2015 12:48  AM" data-short="9 yr">March 11, 2015</time> by sal\_vager**

Aye, it's probably better to have the video hosted externally for convenience. Long-length video files tend to be super-huge, and for some people with less-than-optimal connections (like me), downloading a huge package all in one go is... difficult.

That said, best of luck in your efforts ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)
I don't have that PC anymore i will split it up tough
Yeah, it is best to upload all those videos onto your own YouTube account, and then link to it within your posts.
I currently don't have a PC to do it . Its going to stay like this for a while

VS 2010 ???? Why ?!

Visual Studio 2013 Community is free, up to date and far better than 2010. Get it [here](https://www.visualstudio.com/en-us/products/visual-studio-community-vs.aspx).

Instead of a trial of Visual Studio, people can use [MonoDevelop](http://www.monodevelop.com/download/) which is free.

> 
> I currently don't have a PC to do it . Its going to stay like this for a while

You can split the video from inside Youtube itself:

<iframe width="480" height="270" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/i2Akk5p0aCo?feature=oembed" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen="true"></iframe>

You should be able to upload the video to Youtube from whatever device you're using.

I would also make a strong case for [SharpDevelop](http://www.icsharpcode.net/OpenSource/SD/Default.aspx). It's also free and open source. I find it better than MonoDevelop for those who don't wan't VS. Unfortunately it's Windows only.

> 
> Instead of a trial of Visual Studio, people can use [MonoDevelop](http://www.monodevelop.com/download/) which is free.

MonoDevelop is also built-in to Unity for those familiar with modding KSP.
All i have a chrome book and it doesn't allow me to open or even extract files . And i forget mono develop can work too.

Those strange computer platforms can be tricky, indeed. I try to stay away from anything that claims to be "easy to use, even for the beginner" because I just *know* it's going to bite me in the ... uh... donkey... ahem. yeah...
